intro: Campyloneurum anetioides, commonly known as the Anetoides fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
